text: several R/python packages plot genome browser tracks, require lot coding set . PygenomeTracks one favorite, requires writing .ini configuration files running command-line tools, can cumbersome R users, flexible data exploration. Using ggplot2, possible generate beautiful genome browser plots, although typically requires lot custom code data wrangling. motivated create R package based ggplot2, providing simple high-level functions common track types. goal make easy create publication-quality genome browser plots minimal code, still allowing advanced customization needed.

title: Get started
text: ezGenomeTracks designed around three core principles: modular ggplot2 geoms, simple high-level wrappers, consistent genomic scaling styling. package provides low-level building blocks advanced customization easy--use helpers quick plotting. Easy ez_* wrappers: common use-cases package provides ez_*() helper functions ez_coverage(), ez_gene(), ez_feature(). wrappers accept flexible input types (file paths, data.frame, GRanges, named lists) internally prepare data, select sensible defaults, return full ggplot2 layer complete track can stack genome_plot(). imagine users primarily use high-level wrappers quick plotting. Custom Geoms: power users may want custom plots beyond ez_* wrappers can provide. case, package also exposes set geom_*() layers (e.g. geom_coverage(), geom_gene(), geom_feature(), geom_link(), geom_hic()). regular ggplot2 geoms can use directly ggplot() call. Genomic scales readable labels: Genomic coordinates can large hard read plotted directly. package provides scale_x_genome_region() related helpers transform coordinate labels human-friendly formats enforce consistent axis limits across stacked tracks. Key behaviors: Accepts region specification (string like “chr1:1000-2000” GRanges) sets x limits region stacked tracks share genomic window. Formats tick labels base pairs, kilobases (kb), megabases (Mb) appropriate axis labels compact readable. Optionally shows chromosome names relative offsets make cross-track alignment clear. Using scale_x_genome_region() keeps multi-track plots aligned makes numeric labels concise — e.g., 100,000 becomes 100 kb appropriate. Custom themes simple, pretty plots: package defines ez_theme() minimal base theme track-specific themes ez_coverage_theme() ez_gene_theme(). themes remove unnecessary gridlines, adjust margins, set clean defaults fonts, axis appearance, legend placement resulting tracks visually consistent publication-ready. Themes lightweight composable, can add override small pieces ggplot2 theme calls. Examples themes control: Background grid visibility Y-axis labeling tick formatting strand-aware tracks Default colors palettes Hi-C / interaction plots Spacing stacked tracks (via heights genome_plot()) Example — applying themes tweaking appearance: Stacking tracks vertically genome_plot(): Finally, genome_plot() function takes list ggplot2 layers (ez_* wrappers custom geoms) stacks vertically single plot. handles aligning x-axes, applying themes, adjusting track heights cohesive multi-track visualization. believe powerful yet flexible way compose complex genome browser views allows user tinker individual tracks first combine seamlessly.
